data.title: St. Anthony of Padua Catholic Church, Wailuku, Maui
data.meta_description: Aloha and welcome to the St. Anthony of Padua Catholic Church located in Wailuku, Maui, Hawaii.
data.text:
We, the St. Anthony of Padua Catholic Church, participate in the mission of the Diocese of Honolulu to bring Christ to the world. We are a community of faith that lives and promotes a vibrant family spirit in the Catholic spirituality, and service to the people of God on Maui.

Daily Mass:

Monday - Saturday, 7:00am

Confession:

Saturday: 3:30pm - 4:30pm or by appointment

Blessed Sacrament Chapel:

Daily: 6:30am - 6:30pm

Devotions:

First Friday Devotions with Adoration & Benediction (after 7am Mass)

Novena to Our Lady of Perpetual Help every Wednesday at 7:30am

Evening Prayer with Anointing of the Sick on the last Thursday of the odd number months.

(January, March, May, July, September, November)

And Jesus came and said to them, "All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me. Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you; and lo, I am with you always, to the close of the age."
